name: Chicken Tetrazzini for a Crowd
author: Lois Shaw
summary: If this is too much, make 2 casseroles; eat one, freeze the other. You can also use turkey breast meat. Avanti!
ingredients: 3 (10.75 ounce) cans  condensed cream of mushroom soup
6 cups shredded boiled chicken breast meat
1 (4 ounce) jar sliced pimento peppers, drained
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil
Add uncooked spaghetti (broken into thirds) to the pot and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente
In a large saucepan, heat soup over low heat
Add shredded cheese (reserve some for topping) and stir together
Then add the cooked shredded chicken, mushrooms, pimento peppers and cooked spaghetti and stir all together
Add enough of the reserved broth to make it 'sloppy' and mix all together
Pour mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish
Sprinkle reserved shredded cheese on top and bake in the preheated oven for 25 to 35 minutes or until bubbly
